The pure class interface. 
public class LiteralForm
  extends Form
The class of literal forms.

A literal form represents some fixed user input, and is usually used in choice-like structures to indicate an option or a path to enter.

Author:
Wolfgang Grieskamp (wg@cs.tu-berlin.de)
Version: $Id: LiteralForm.pizza,v 1.2 1998/10/22 09:02:20 wg Exp $

Construct a literal form from a keyword

The keyword of the literal form.

Get syntax description

The keyword of the literal form.

parse
public int parse(Session session,
                 Locator locator,
                 String[] words,
                 int start);
Parse the given sequence of words starting at index. Parsing succeeds if the keyword of the literal form starts the sequence.

Overrides:
parse in class Form

unparse

public String[] unparse(Session session);
Unparse the internal state of the form. Returns the singleton array containing the keyword of this literal form.
